text: This list of dinosaur specimens with documented taphonomic histories enumerates those fossil dinosaur specimens that have been subjected to focused efforts aimed at reconstructing the events following the animal's death and the processes by which its remains were preserved in the fossil record. ==Ceratopsians== {| class="wikitable sortable" align="center" width="100%" |- ! Nickname ! Catalogue Number ! Institution ! Taxon ! Age ! Unit ! Country ! Description and Taphonomic History ! Images |- | Fighting Dinosaurs | GI SPS 100/512 | Geological Institute, Section of Palaeontology and Stratigraphy of the Mongolian Academy of Sciences | Protoceratops andrewsi | | | Mongolia | Preserves Protoceratops andrewsi locked in combat with a Velociraptor mongoliensis. | rowspan="47"| The "Fighting Dinosaurs" specimen of V. mongoliensis and Protoceratops andrewsi |- |} ==Ornithopods== ===Hadrosaurs=== {| class="wikitable sortable" align="center" width="100%" |- ! Nickname ! Catalogue Number ! Institution ! Taxon ! Age ! Unit ! Country ! Description and Taphonomic History ! Images |- | Lizzie | 2000 P-02Pasch and May (2001); "Introduction," page 220. | University of Alaska Museum | Hadrosauridae, indeterminate.Pasch and May (2001); "Hadrosaur Skeletal Material from the Talkeetna Mountains," page 224. | Middle TuronianPasch and May (2001); "Age of the Bone-Bearing Unit," page 220. | Matanuska FormationPasch and May (2001); "Location and Geologic Setting," page 220. | United States | This specimen was the first occurrence of a hadrosaur in south-central Alaska, one out of only four vertebrate fossils from the entire Wrangellia Composite Terrane, and the first associated skeleton of an individual dinosaur in Alaska. | rowspan="47"| The "Trachodon mummy". |- | Trachodon mummy | AMNH 5060 | American Museum of Natural History | Edmontosaurus annectens | | | United States | |- |} ==Theropods== ===Dromaeosaurs=== {| class="wikitable sortable" align="center" width="100%" |- ! Nickname ! Catalogue Number ! Institution ! Taxon ! Age ! Unit ! Country ! Description and Taphonomic History ! Images |- | Fighting Dinosaurs | GI SPS 100/25 | Geological Institute, Section of Palaeontology and Stratigraphy of the Mongolian Academy of Sciences | Velociraptor mongoliensis | Middle Campanian | Djadokhta Formation | Mongolia | Preserves a Velociraptor mongoliensis locked in combat with a Protoceratops andrewsi. | rowspan="47"| The "Fighting Dinosaurs" specimen of V. mongoliensis and Protoceratops andrewsi |- |} ==Footnotes== ==References== * Pasch, A. D., K. C. May. 2001. Taphonomy and paleoenvironment of hadrosaur (Dinosauria) from the Matanuska Formation (Turonian) in South-Central Alaska. In: Mesozoic Vertebrate Life. Ed.s Tanke, D. H., Carpenter, K., Skrepnick, M. W. Indiana University Press. Pages 219-236. Category:Lists of dinosaur specimens
title: List of dinosaur specimens with documented taphonomic histories
